newsitem.title: CHINA: China's new state debt - 10 percent already sold.
newsitem.headline: China's new state debt - 10 percent already sold.

text.p: A total of 10 percent of the latest batch of state debt, valued at 123 billion yuan ($14.8 billion), has been sold since the issue opened on March 1, the Shanghai Securites News said on Monday.
The issue, consisting of non-tradeable treasury notes of two, three and five years maturity, will last until October 20.
Beijing has set the annual coupons for the debt at about one percentage point above interest rates for bank deposits of the same duration.
The newspaper quoted deputy finance minister Liu Jibing as saying the state debt issue in 1997 would focus on meeting the requirements of individual investors.
China's target for domestic and overseas debt in 1997 is 248.596 billion yuan, up 27.3 percent over 1996, the Finance Ministry said early this month.
China issued 196.742 billion yuan in state debt last year, or 1.485 billion yuan above the budgeted figure of 195.257 billion yuan.
